channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 25 states in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash violently with police.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE updates: White House riots intensify as violence ensues across the US, curfews imposed on multiple cities

item.description: Fox showed a photoshopped image of Hitler in the crowd during Manly's clash with Canterbury on Sunday Night with Matty Johns. It drew immediate criticism online.
item.title: 'Not acceptable': Apologies from Fox Sports and Matty Johns after Hitler skit

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Podiatrists are seeing more patients with flare-ups due to improper footwear being worn at home, including the beloved slippers.
item.title: 'Ugg boot foot' and related injuries on the rise

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Deputy Police Commissioner Shane Patton will take over from Graham Ashton, the Premier has announced.
item.title: Victoria's new police chief commissioner announced

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The ground's grandstands in Sydney's inner west have been a familiar sight for motorists using Parramatta Road for more than three decades.
item.title: Oval grandstands demolition kicks off major revamp

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 restrictions eased in NSW as Victorian authorities scramble to contain Keilor Downs cluster; Australian death toll at 103

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A boat believed to belong to Paul Brazier, 37, was found off Fraser Island on Thursday after he failed to return from an overnight trip two days earlier.
item.title: Search scaled back for missing Fraser Coast fisherman

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Kandos and other towns like it are struggling to keep their tiny museums open since foot traffic dried up during lockdown .
item.title: State's community-run museums threatened with closure

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: This will be the biggest spend on such a campaign ever, bigger than Do it in WA which was quickly announced then just as quickly canned as the pandemic took hold.
item.title: Premier launches WA's biggest ever holiday-at-home marketing push

item.description: Friends asked Dannyll Goodsell why she was still in a relationship with Scott Charles Cameron. She told them she was too afraid to leave.
item.title: Mum who was stabbed 55 times told friends she was 'scared' of killer

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Sarah Vaughan maximised an improbable gift, but not for her whole career.
item.title: Touched by the gods, soiled by executives

item.description: Supercars driver Will Davison has avoided injury despite being struck by a van, which his wife said "swerved intentionally" at them while they were on a morning run.
item.title: Supercars driver Davison 'intentionally' hit by van

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: 'Shoppies' union urges the Premier to stand with the Chinese people, not its 'authoritarian' government.
item.title: History will judge Andrews on Belt and Road, warns union leader

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Along with his international teammates David Warner and Mitchell Starc, the former Australia captain reported for NSW training on Monday.
item.title: 'I haven't touched a bat': Steve Smith returns to training after long break

item.description: Majak Daw will not require surgery on his torn pectoral muscle, preserving the North Melbourne defender's hopes of an AFL comeback this season.
item.title: Daw avoids surgery in comeback boost

item.description: Lawyers, bankers, professors and other professionals describe a growing culture of fear in offices across the city.
item.title: Hong Kong workers report harassment by China

item.description: British migrant Martin McDonagh used a string of false names to rip off eight people for work that was never started, never finished or done without permits.
item.title: Fake tradie jailed for $360k home repairs scam could be free in months

item.description: The party is "intent upon the destruction of Western ideas," the US Secretary of State said.
item.title: Pompeo dials up criticism of Chinese Communist Party in Hong Kong fight

item.description: Lifting the limit early on how far Queenslanders can travel will flush tourism towns with cash and get the sector back on the move after months of COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Queensland tourism readies for holiday boom

item.description: Violent protests spread across the US in the wake of the death 46-year-old George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Riots across the US

item.description: USA protests spread across America and Europe after the death of George Floyd in police custody.
item.title: George Floyd protests go global

item.description: Socceroos defender Milos Degenek's return to action with Serbian club Red Star Belgrade has ended in triumph.
item.title: Degenek helps Red Star seal Serbian title

item.dc:creator: Gabriella Coslovich
item.description: You call a number. The performer answers, and the play begins. A production invented a decade ago has new, potent relevance.
item.title: This theatrical production is waiting for your call

item.description: The latest episode of our markets podcast includes an expert view on the likelihood of a second wave of infections.
item.title: Short Squeeze: Economic data and a epidemiologist's view of COVID-19

item.description: The master of a container ship that lost about 50 containers overboard has faced a Queensland court over allegations of poor cargo loading.
item.title: Ship's master faces court over cargo spill

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: On a beautiful sunny day, Sydneysiders have embraced the city's cultural resurrection by visiting galleries and libraries for the first time in months.
item.title: 'Moment of great optimism': Sydney's cultural institutions open their doors

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Media companies are legally responsible for allegedly defamatory comments of readers on their corporate Facebook pages, the NSW Court of Appeal has ruled.
item.title: Media companies lose appeal over Facebook defamation ruling

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: A Canadian company is building a $50m plant in Melbourne's south east to help the local medicinal cannabis industry become more self-sufficient.
item.title: Australia's biggest medicinal cannabis plant to be built in secret Melbourne location

item.description: Storm forward Nelson Asofa-Solomona will miss Friday's NRL blockbuster against South Sydney after taking the early guilty plea for his dangerous contact charge.
item.title: Melbourne's Asofa-Solomona accepts NRL ban

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The toddler vanished from his foster-grandmother's home in the sleepy town of Kendall on the Mid North Coast in September 2014.
item.title: People 'withholding information' in Tyrrell disappearance, court told

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: General manager Sarah-Jane Tilbury reckons the fish, fowl and other creatures of the deep that live at Melbourne Aquarium have missed visitors a lot.
item.title: Aquarium reopens with penguin called Quentin Quarantino set to star

item.description: Underdone Brisbane forward says Thursday night's torrid 34-6 loss to Parramatta was the shock to the system he and the team needed.
item.title: Lodge expects more from Broncos

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: A Depression-era larrikin is farewelled by those who loved him most, including his dog, Cindy.
item.title: 'Grief on hold': The pandemic changed the way we mourn

item.description: Making leather bags and leather slippers: art installer Tops dug into her craft skills under lockdown.
item.title: With no art to hang, Simone Tops got out her leather craft tools

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: Ben Fordham took over from Alan Jones on the 2GB breakfast shift this morning.
item.title: No sleep and Sunday morning tears: Ben Fordham takes over breakfast

item.description: One new case linked to a hotel where quarantined travellers are staying.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: Over the past week there’ve been some curious fluctuations in the value of China’s currency that could ramp up tensions with the US.
item.title: China's currency could trigger a new flashpoint in the growing cold war with the US

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: "The health and safety of all our visitors, staff and volunteers is our highest priority," says Museums Victoria chief executive Lynley Crosswell.
item.title: Major cultural institutions to reopen in time for school holidays

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: For weeks now Belgium has been written off as an unrivalled catastrophe. But the dire numbers don't tell the full story.
item.title: Is Belgium the world's deadliest COVID-19 country or just the most honest?

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Graeme Sleeman plans to sue over the Archdiocese of Melbourne's catastrophic lack of action in the 1980s on his complaints about Father Peter Searson.
item.title: Former principal who warned of dangerous priest to sue Catholic Church

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A watch described as "the iPhone of its day" belonging to the city of Brisbane's namesake Sir Thomas Brisbane is expected to fetch about $500,000 at auction.
item.title: Brisbane’s ‘iPhone of the 1800s’ watch to go under the hammer

item.description: Violent protests spread across the US in the wake of the death 46-year-old George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US riots

item.description: Patrick Cripps says the Blues are hungry to make an impact when the AFL season restarts next week but has played down the advantage of spending the first month in Victoria.
item.title: Blues eager to deliver in AFL, says Cripps

item.description: Not many Goldman Sachs partners seek out citizenship in a tiny Caribbean island to speed through airports. Ali Meli wasn't your typical Goldman partner.
item.title: Legend of Ali: The unlikely figure in Wall Street's most elite club is going it alone

item.description: Robert Smith – art historian, art collector, cultural historian, theatrical performer, Shakespearean, teacher, and public benefactor – has died peacefully in Wonthaggi.
item.title: Always learning was his motto

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The Sunwolves won't take part in Rugby Australia's domestic competition set to begin in July.
item.title: Sunwolves ruled out of Australian Super Rugby reboot

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The federal government has provided a three-step roadmap to start carefully relaxing limits on our movement. Here's how each state is easing its coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: COVID-19: What are the public health rules now?

item.description: The WA Day long weekend has brought grief to families, with the road deaths of these two young women, as well as a motorbike rider in his 30s.
item.title: Driver on manslaughter charges after alleged hit-and-run kills two Perth women

item.description: ARLC chairman Peter V'landys has confirmed the NRL will use its agreement with the NSW government as leverage to get suburban grounds rebuilt.
item.title: NRL expects NSW government to stand by stadium deal
